title: 49. Why Don’t We Have a Cure for Alzheimer’s?
description: Promising drugs keep failing in trials. Allegations of fraud have cast a shadow over the field. An expert explains why Alzheimer’s treatments have been so hard to find — and why one clue may lie in the Andes Mountains.
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Promising drugs keep failing in trials. Allegations of fraud have cast a shadow over the field. An expert explains why Alzheimer’s treatments have been so hard to find — and why one clue may lie in the Andes Mountains.
